# `r fontawesome::fa(name = "list-check")` How to manage translations {background-color=var(--s3)}

## Basic workflow {.t3}

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="60%"}
![](assets/15/translation_file.png){fig-align="center"}
:::

::: {.column width="40%"}

1. Create one template per target translation
1. Send spreadsheet to translator
1. Provide instructions on what not to change
1. Import completed translation

:::

::::

## Better workflow {.t3}

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="60%"}
![](assets/15/translation_management.png){fig-align="center"}
:::

::: {.column width="40%"}

1. Download translation template
1. Create one column per target language
1. Upload spreadsheet to file sharing service (e.g., Google Drive, Microsoft 365, OneDrive, Dropbox, etc.)
1. Provide translators access to edit that document
1. Provide comments and track status
1. Convert into one translation file per target language
1. Import completed translation

:::

::::
